from scipy.stats import ttest_ind

for q in df2['Quarter'].unique():
    mask1 = df2['Quarter'] == q
    mask2 = df2['Sugar Type'] == 'Centrifugal'
    mask3 = df2['Sugar Type'] == 'Gur(Jaggery)'
    
    data1 = df2.loc[(mask1) & (mask2), 'Value'].to_numpy()
    data2 = df2.loc[(mask1) & (mask3), 'Value'].to_numpy()
    
    var1 = np.nanstd(data1)
    var2 = np.nanstd(data2)
    
    stat, p = ttest_ind(data1, data2, nan_policy='omit')
    
    print(f'Quarter: {q}, p = {p:5.3f}, std. dif = {var2 - var1:6.3f}')
